Text: FERC Special Meetings on Friday and Monday The Capitol Connection is pleased to announce that it will broadcast via the internet and telephone Only the following Federal Energy Regulatory Commission Special Meetings Friday October am ET Topic Interstate Natural Gas Facility Planning Seminar Presentation of Staff Findings Monday October pm ET Topic Technical Conference Concerning WestWide Price Mitigation for Winter Season Procedures for seeking participation If you have an annual subscription to the Capitol Connection internet service these meetings are included in the annual fee Please contact us if you are interested in signing up for either of these meetings or want to get an annual subscription to our internet service The Capitol Connection offers FERC meetings live via the Internet as well as via Phone Bridge and satellite please visit our website at wwwcapitolconnectionorg or send email to for more information If there is a meeting you are interested in receiving please call David Reininger Meeting dates and times are subject to change without notice For current information you can go to our website at wwwcapitolconnectionorg and select the FERC link or you can go to the FERC web page at wwwfercfedus The FERC Office of the Secretary can be reached at

FERC Video Archives now available through the Capitol Connectionyou can access the archives of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission FERC meetings via the internet using Real Player The Capitol Connection is offering this service for free for a limited time If you have not already registered and received the login name and password for the archives please go to and click on the FERC link on the sidebar Then click and complete the Archive Registration and you will receive your login name and password If you are interested in the Live or Archived meetings of the Federal Communications Commission FCC or National Transportation Safety Board NTSB please contact us If you have any questions concerning the FERC Video Archives please contact us at or at Thank you The Capitol Connection George Mason University Television PH

Audio problems during beginning of the FERC Open Meeting on During the first few minutes of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission Open Meeting today there was an audio problem at the FERC that was beyond our control We will rebroadcast the first minutes of the FERC Open meeting immediately after the meeting ends on our cable internet and phone systems If you have any questions please contact our office at or Thank you

Update FERC has Cancelled the Special RTO MeetingThe Federal Energy Regulatory Commission FERC has cancelled the Special RTO meeting scheduled for Thursday February The next meeting date for the FERC is the Open Meeting on Wednesday February scheduled for am ET If you have any questions please contact our office at or Thank you The Capitol Connection

FERC Internet UpdateThank you very much for your continued use of the Capitol Connections Internet service that connects you to Federal Energy Regulatory Commission meetings live from Washington DC The Capitol Connection is pleased to announce a new level of enhanced Service using Real One It allows you to view meeting agendas while simultaneously viewing the archive of the meeting As soon as possible please visit the following link and follow the directions to download Real One at no charge it is the latest version of the Real Player Updating to Real One also will allow us to provide better customer service by assuring all our patrons are using the latest technology to view Capitol Connection programming In the future archives of FERC meetings provided by the Capitol Connection will be edited using the meetings agenda when available This will allow you to access a point in the archive where a particular item of interest as shown on the agenda is to be addressed We always welcome your suggestions for ways to improve our service Currently we are researching making the archives searchable and would like your feedback Would this service be of interest to you and what features or functions would best serve you Your input is greatly appreciated Please do not hesitate to contact us with suggestions or questions at capcon mailtogmuedu mailto or by calling Thank you very much and we look forward to continuing to provide you with quality service Regards David Reininger

Enhanced Services UpdateCurrently we are researching ways to enhance our Internet services to you and making our FERC archives searchable and would like your feedback Would this service be of interest to you and what features or functions would best serve you After our previous email we had several questions concerning upgrading to the new Real One player Do you have to upgrade to the new Real One player to view FERC our programming No you can still use Real Player We suggested that you upgrade because of the new features Real One offers making it easier to view the agenda while playing the archive When using a previous version of Real you just have to go back and forth between the two windows browser player to see the agenda The new player just makes it easier and more convenient for you to view the agenda and video in one window When I go to download the Real One they want my credit card number How do I get the Free Real One Player Unfortunately Real does not make finding the Real One Free player easy When you go to the web page wwwrealcom go about half way down and on a gray bar going across the page you will see Our Free Player click that link and you will be taken to another page On the new page look in the lower right hand corner toward the bottom of page and you will see a link Download the Free RealOne Player Only You will then need to fill out their paperwork choose the option that you are a new user and register but will not be charged As always if you have any questions or need help downloading or installing the Real Player please contact our office at or Thank you

MISOPJMSPP Single Market Forum on will be broadcast by the Capitol ConnectionThe Capitol Connection is pleased to announce that it will broadcast via the internet and telephone only the Single Market Design Forum convened by the Midwest Independent Transmission System Operator Inc MISO PJM Interconnection and Southwest Power Pool Inc SPP It will be held on Friday February from am to pm ET For more information on this Forum please go to wwwmisopjmsppcom This Forum is to discuss the development of a single market that meets the needs of all customers and stakeholders using the electric power grid in the regions served by them Central to the development of a single market is a design that meets the needs of market participants through onestop shopping This Forum will be available to Capitol Connection FERC Annual Internet Contract Patrons at no additional charge If you do not have a yearly Internet contract and would like to receive the Forum via the Internet or phone click here for the contract or call
